text: Cylichnidae, common name the "chalice bubble snails" or "canoe bubble snails" is a family of sea snails or bubble snails, marine gastropod mollusks in the superfamily Cylichnoidea. MolluscaBase eds. (2020). MolluscaBase. Cylichnidae H. Adams & A. Adams, 1854. Accessed through: World Register of Marine Species at: http://www.marinespecies.org/aphia.php?p=taxdetails&id;=159 on 2020-10-02 == Taxonomy == === 2005 taxonomy === This family has been classified within the clade Cephalaspidea, itself belonging to the informal group Opisthobranchia (according to the taxonomy of the Gastropoda by Bouchet & Rocroi, 2005). The family Cylichnidae has no subfamilies (according to the taxonomy of the Gastropoda by Bouchet & Rocroi, 2005). Synonyms of Cylichnidae has included: Scaphandridae G. O. Sars, 1878; Tornatinidae P. Fischer, 1883; Acteocinidae Dall, 1913 and Triclidae Winckworth, 1932. === 2009 taxonomy === Malaquias et al. (2009)Malaquias M. A. E., Dodds J. M., Bouchet P. & Reid D. G. (2009). "A molecular phylogeny of the Cephalaspidea sensu lato (Gastropoda: Euthyneura): Architectibranchia redefined and Runcinacea reinstated". Zoologica Scripta 38(1): 23-41. . have reinstated Scaphandridae as a valid family. ==Genera== Genera within the family Cylichnidae include: * Adamnestia Iredale, 1936Bouchet, P. (2010). Adamnestia Iredale, 1936. Accessed through: World Register of Marine Species at http://www.marinespecies.org/aphia.php?p=taxdetails&id;=531506 on 2010-12-15 * Bogasonia Warén, 1989 * Cylichna Lovén, 1846 \- type genusValdés A. & Camacho- García Y. (2004). ""Cephalaspidean" Heterobranchs (Gastropoda) from the Pacific Coast of Costa Rica". Proceedings of the California Academy of Sciences 55: 459-497. PDF. * † Cylichnania Marwick, 1931 * Cylichnella Gabb, 1873Bouchet, P. (2010). Cylichnella Gabb, 1873. (2010). Sphaerocylichna Thiele, 1925.
